buildup.text: Anticipatory repudiation occurs when a party clearly indicates they won't perform before the deadline arrives.

discovery.text: The innocent party can immediately treat it as a breach, sue for damages, or seek a substitute deal.

twist.text: The repudiating party can retract their refusalâ€”but only if the other side hasn't already relied on the repudiation.

climax.text: This doctrine prevents waste: why wait for a deadline everyone knows will be missed?

punchline.text: Saying 'I won't do it' is just as much a breach as not doing it.

quiz.question: What is anticipatory repudiation?
options: Declaring in advance you won't perform
